page.title: 05St.Oswalds Church
page.content: A fragment of the original village of {Kirk Sandall}lies some way off near the canal.It houses an ancient and curious church. It is no longer used for worship though the churchyard is still used for burials.On rare occasions the church is opened and the general upkeep and maintenance of the church comes under the{redundant {churches}commission.Amongst several unusual features the{herringbone work in the nave is believed to be{Saxon and the 16th.C.north chapel was built by{William Rokeby,Archbishop of Dublin,who was formerly a rector of Kirk Sandall.In 1985 the white marble monument to Rokeby was removed and the north window unbricked to allow the first restoration work on this part of the church for 300 years.It has good stained glass and a fine {pre-reformation wooden chancel screen.
